company.name: Tennessee Football, Inc.
company.business_description: Tennessee Football, Inc. owns and operates the Tennessee Titans professional football team, which is a member of the National Football League.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Tennessee Football, Inc., which owns and operates the Tennessee Titans football team, claimed to participate in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework on its website. The company self-certified to the Safe Harbor Framework in August 2005 but failed to renew its certification in August 2009. Despite its certification status being updated to 'not current,' the company continued to represent on its website that it complied with the EU Safe Harbor framework from August 2009 until November 2013.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: Through the means described in Paragraph 11, respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it was a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claim
counts.representation: The company represented that it was a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: From August 2009 until November 2013, respondent was not a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 12 is false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: Tennessee Football, Inc. and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy or security program, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in privacy or security programs
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC all documents relating to compliance with this order for five years from the date of preparation or dissemination.

requirements.description: Maintain records for 5 years and make available for FTC inspection
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent's compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.

requirements.description: Deliver order to current personnel within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel within 30 days of assuming position
requirements.quoted_text: to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities

requirements.description: Obtain signed acknowledgment of receipt within 30 days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notice of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC within 14 days of any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations, including mergers, dissolutions, or changes in corporate structure.

requirements.description: Notify FTC within 14 days of corporate changes affecting compliance
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission within fourteen (14) days of any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the FTC within 90 days after service of the order and submit additional reports within 10 days upon request.

requirements.description: File initial compliance report within 90 days
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within ninety (90) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order.

requirements.description: Submit additional reports within 10 days upon FTC request
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate 20 years from June 19, 2014, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging violation of the order, whichever is later.

requirements.description: Order remains in effect for 20 years with extensions for violations
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; B. this order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part.
